page.title: 15SOUTH DOWNS WAY
page.content: The most famous bridleway in our block is the South Downs Way which runs from west to east across the top of the Downs. We interviewed a local postman and keen Sussex walker who gave us information about the South Downs Way. It became a public right of way in 1949 because the National Parks required the making of long routes. Today the Local Highway Authority with the County Council looks after the path although it is financed by the Countryside Commission. The 8O-mile way is one of the most famous and interesting walks in the British Isles. On most days especially summer weekends, parents with children, hikers and horse riders may be seen on the slopes of the Way enjoying the magnificent views. Exploring open country becomes more popular as road congestion grows.
